meanings.definition: To bring to a common center; to concentrate.
meanings.sent1: Let's concenter all our efforts on finishing this project.
meanings.sent2: The students concentered their attention on the teacher during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: Trying to concenter all the toys in one box was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts concentered on the upcoming exam, causing her anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes concentered on the vibrant colors of the sunset.

meanings.definition: To come to a common center; to converge.
meanings.sent1: The roads concenter at the town square.
meanings.sent2: The lines of the drawing concentered towards the focal point.
meanings.sent3: The children's laughter concentered in the playground, making it a joyful place.
